org.gridgain.grid
Class GridListenActor<T>

java.lang.Object
  org.gridgain.grid.lang.GridMetadataAwareAdapter
      org.gridgain.grid.lang.GridLambdaAdapter
          org.gridgain.grid.lang.GridPredicate2<UUID,T>
              org.gridgain.grid.GridListenActor<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, GridMetadataAware, GridPeerDeployAware, GridLambda
public abstract class GridListenActor<T>
extends GridPredicate2<UUID,T>

Actor-base adapter for GridProjection.listen(GridPredicate2[]) method. Look at GridFunctionPingPong.java example class for usage sample.

GridListenActor

public GridListenActor()
Method Detail

setContext

public final void setContext(Grid grid,
                             Collection<GridRichNode> nodes)
Internal method that is called by GridGain runtime to set local context. This method is called once and before method GridListenActor.receive(UUID, Object) is called for the first time.

Note that this method is only public due to fucked up visibility support in Java...

Parameters:
grid - Local grid instance this actor belongs to.
nodes - Collection of nodes this actor is listening to.

Gets grid instance associated with this actor.

Returns:
Grid instance associated with this actor.

nodes

Gets collection of nodes this actor is listening on.

Returns:
Collection of nodes this actor is listening on.

apply

                           T rcvMsg)
Predicate body.

Specified by:
apply in class GridPredicate2<UUID,T>
Parameters:
nodeId - First bound free variable, i.e. the element the closure is called or closed on.
rcvMsg - Second bound free variable, i.e. the element the closure is called or closed on.
Returns:
Return value.

onError

protected void onError(Throwable e)
This method is called in case when method GridListenActor.receive(UUID, Object) threw an exception. Insides of this method the implementation should call any of the respond, stop or skip methods. If overriding method does nothing - than return value of method GridListenActor.receive(UUID, Object) is undefined.

Default implementation simply calls method GridListenActor.stop().

Parameters:
e - Exception thrown from method receive(UUID, Object).

receive

protected abstract void receive(UUID nodeId,
                                T recvMsg)
                         throws Throwable
This method receives the message. This is the only method that subclass needs to override. Insides of this method the implementation should call any of the respond, stop or skip methods. Note that if none of these methods are called - listener will continue listen for the new messages.

Note that like all predicate in GridProjection.listen(GridPredicate2[]) method this method is called in synchronized context so that only thread can access it at a time.

Throws:
Throwable - Thrown in case of any errors. Method onError(Throwable)} will be called right before returning from this method.
Parameters:
nodeId - ID of the sender node.
recvMsg - Received message.

stop

protected final void stop()
This method instructs underlying implementation to stop receiving new messages and unregister the message listener.

Note that subclasses can call any of respond, stop or skip methods any number of times. Only the last executed method will determine whether or not the implementation will continue listen for the new messages.

stop

protected final void stop(@Nullable
                          Object respMsg)
                   throws GridException
This method sends the response message to the original sender node and instructs underlying implementation to stop receiving new messages and unregister the message listener.

Note that subclasses can call any of respond, stop or skip methods any number of times. Only the last executed method will determine whether or not the implementation will continue listen for the new messages.

Throws:
GridException - Thrown in case of any errors.
Parameters:
respMsg - Optional response message. If not null - it will be sent to the original sender node.

skip

protected final void skip()
Skips current message and continues to listen for new message. This method simply calls respond(null).

Note that subclasses can call any of respond, stop or skip methods any number of times. Only the last executed method will determine whether or not the implementation will continue listen for the new messages.

respond

protected final void respond(@Nullable
                             Object respMsg)
                      throws GridException
Responds to the original sender node with given message and continues to listen for the new messages.

Note that subclasses can call any of respond, stop or skip methods any number of times. Only the last executed method will determine whether or not the implementation will continue listen for the new messages.

Throws:
GridException - Thrown in case of any errors.
Parameters:
respMsg - Optional response message. If not null - it will be sent to the original sender node.

respond

protected final void respond(UUID id,
                             @Nullable
                             Object respMsg)
                      throws GridException
Responds to the provided node with given message and continues to listen for the new messages.

Note that subclasses can call any of respond, stop or skip methods any number of times. Only the last executed method will determine whether or not the implementation will continue listen for the new messages.

Throws:
GridException - Thrown in case of any errors.
Parameters:
id - ID of the node to send the message to, if any.
respMsg - Optional response message. If not null - it will be sent to the original sender node.

public String toString()
